intro: Fimbristylis striolata, commonly known as the streaked flat sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial grass-like plant that typically grows in wet or marshy environments. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. It is native to Australia and is often found in coastal regions. Fimbristylis striolata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
